page.title: 13Home life in S.E. Guildford
page.content:
Most of the owners in White Lane, Little Warren Close and Chilworth have lived there for twenty to thirty years. The main fuels used are gas, oil and electricity. Normally three meals are eaten in the day and the main meal is usually eaten in the evening. A roast is popular on Sundays. The main evening entertainments are television, computing, music and watching video recordings.
Most people have burglar alarms and safety locks on windows. Dogs and cats are the most popular pets, and dogs are sometimes used as guard dogs. The residents own one or two cars mostly of foreign make, although the Rover is also popular. The average family size is five, but most of the children have either left home, married or got jobs.
